sentence.text: Various genes (eg, regulation of mitochondrial membrane permeability, Golgi organization, glycerophospholipid catabolic process) traditionally rooted in either the ataxia or hereditary spastic paraplegia classification system have now been shown to cause ataxia on the one end of the disease continuum and hereditary spastic paraplegia on the other.
Other genes such as bile acid metabolic process and anterograde neuronal dense core vesicle transport were almost simultaneously published as both a hereditary spastic paraplegia and an ataxia gene.

entity.text: anterograde neuronal dense core vesicle transport
